intro: Citriobatus megacarpus, commonly known as the giant citron tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Rutaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its large, citrus-like fruits that can weigh up to several kilograms. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils. The botanical features of Citriobatus megacarpus make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
